guide.title: Detailed Guide

upload.title: Upload Audio Files
upload.desc: Upload audio files in supported formats: MP3, WAV, FLAC, OGG, M4A, AAC.
upload.tip: Tip: You can upload multiple files at once or add them via drag & drop.

analyze.title: Analyze Audio
analyze.desc: The analysis function determines important audio parameters:
analyze.peak: Peak Level (dBFS): Highest volume level of the audio file
analyze.lufs: LUFS: Loudness Units relative to Full Scale (Broadcast Standard)
analyze.dynamic: Dynamic Range: Difference between loudest and quietest parts
analyze.noise: Noise Floor: Background noise of the recording

rms.title: RMS Normalization
rms.desc: Normalizes the average loudness to a target value.
rms.note: Note: Lower dB values mean quieter audio signals.

peak.title: Peak/dB Normalization
peak.desc: Normalizes the highest level (peak) to a target value.

ebu.title: EBU R128 (LUFS)
ebu.desc: Broadcast standard for consistent loudness across different programs/tracks.

noise.title: Noise Reduction
noise.desc: Reduces background noise and improves speech intelligibility.
noise.ideal: Ideal for: Podcasts, Voice-Overs, Interview recordings

clipping.title: Reduce Clipping
clipping.desc: Corrects overdriven signals and restores details in distorted areas.
clipping.note: Important: This function can reduce distortion but not completely remove it.

compression.title: Dynamic Compression
compression.desc: Reduces the difference between loud and quiet passages for more consistent loudness.
compression.threshold: Threshold: Level at which compression starts
compression.attack: Attack: How quickly the compressor responds
compression.release: Release: How quickly the compressor releases

batch.desc: Perform operations on all loaded files simultaneously:
batch.normalizeDesc: Normalizes all files with the selected method
batch.enhanceDesc: Noise reduction, clipping reduction, or compression on all
batch.exportDesc: Exports all processed files as ZIP
batch.deleteDesc: Removes all files from the list

export.single: Single Export: Click "Export" on a file
export.batch: Batch Export: Use "Export All" for ZIP download
export.format: Format: Exports in original format or as WAV

tip1.title: 1. Always analyze first
tip1.desc: Analyze your files before normalization to determine optimal parameters.

tip2.title: 2. Watch headroom
tip2.desc: Always leave some headroom (e.g. -1 dB) to avoid clipping.

tip3.title: 3. Use preview
tip3.desc: Listen to the result before exporting (Original/Normalized toggle).

tip4.title: 4. Choose the right method
tip4.desc: RMS for music, Peak for maximum loudness, EBU R128 for broadcast/streaming.

tip5.title: 5. Don't over-compress
tip5.desc: Too much compression makes audio flat and lifeless. Less is often more.
